text:
- Our organization
(bright, upbeat music)

is responsible for setting
the long-term vision
of our organization
and then implementing that
through an everyday data-driven process.
So the challenge we solve with AWS
is that we had built about a decade ago,
an in-house data warehouse.
And over the last 10 years,

unfortunately, we've
underinvested in that asset,

and so it become really
technically inefficient

as well as carrying a lot of
legacy debt attached to it.
And so this asset

is really used across our
entire sales organization
and really kind of a central point
of how we manage the business
and had become really inefficient
and so became a liability for us to use
from day in and day out

because our sales professionals
use this data warehouse

to manage their territories,
their prospects,

and their existing clients
day in and day out,

as to become more of a
liability than an asset.
So we wanted to make sure

that as we are making
this major investment
in this data asset,

that we're choosing a
best in class provider.

And AWS came top of
marks in every category.

So we were really impressed
with kind of the services
and capabilities that came with AWS

and just their commitment
to ongoing innovation,

which is really important
for us going forward.

What we did on AWS was build
a cloud first data platform,

and we used a number of in-house
and external technologies,
things like Glue, Lambda, S3,
and a bunch of other capabilities
that come out of the box out of AWS

before all this data was
warehoused in different places.

And now, everything is in
one connected solution.

That gives us this 360 view
of our sales professionals

and all the people that
they're interacting with.
That allows us to have richer insights
to, again, make better decisions,
both short term and long term.
(bright, upbeat music continues)
